Subject: bdb:bdb-cache-percent setting disabled - why?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=328973242; y=m_zMwL9ddgcqgEvLDj4bQCJ9Vps4Lzqfzg3L7cjsCrOC_A
X-Yahoo-Profile: hlausen

Hi,

I hope I do not miss something obvious, but I believe to remember being
able to modify "bdb-cache-percent", which is particularly usefull to
avoid OOM when using the BloomUriUniqFilter on machines with only
moderate RAM, or when running multiple jobs in parallel. In 2.0.0 I get
"You cannot edit this setting because it was specifically set for the
settings framework. Changing it could destabilize the framework. This
setting is only provided in case you want to reuse it in another
module." when trying modify this property.

Any pointer appreciated.

best
  Holger
